item.description:
Hi to All,

Monday April 6, New Horizons in Woburn 7-8:30- wrap up and leave by 9 PM.

Rates are still falling...question is, where can you get a loan?

I have met with some banks and mortgage brokers over the past couple of months, to see what is available to new homeowners, and to investors. For the first time buyers, there are some sweet deals! Because of my new property (almost done and ready for the market!) that I am targeting to sell to a firsttimer, I have been digging in on what is available. Good news for some areas, there are target HUD districts where no interest loans and/or grants can be available to fully or partially defray the 3.5% down payment and closing costs for an FHA loan. Folks can get in for almost no down payment. My property will be able to be owned for a little less than an average rent for a similar unit!

For investors, it is still pretty tight and requires a heavy % of cash in. Money out refis are hard to come by, too. For my property, there were REO restrictions that caused more obstacles and challenges. It's a dance out there, but when we learn the basic steps, it can be done. I will be sharing how it is working for me on this project. (I went hard money) Also before and afters to share, and my marketing strategies.

I was fortunate enough to go to the Brookview weekend featuring Robyn Thompson, and got some terrific tips and insights there to share with you.

Let's plan, too, to talk about the real estate market, the impact of the stimulus package, and what projects and plans you are into. I am looking forward to a great conversation!

Warm regards,
Annie
